title: Is an infinite regress impossible due to every link in the chain being dependent on the previous link, and because none of the links have had the requirements for their existence fulfilled, none of the links would exist? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are referring to an infinite regress of universes or some such causal chain, one can’t claim it’s impossible just because there is no known mechanism for it. That doesn’t mean one is free to claim it’s true either as long as it remains unvalidated. However no attempt at philosophically discrediting infinite regression rises above sophistry.
